prompts.createTask:
Ignore previous instructions. Please generate a numbered list of plain text tasks to complete an objective. The objective that you must make a numbered task list for is: "{{objective}}". The tasks created should take into account the character traits of {{char}}. These tasks may or may not involve {{user}} directly. Include the objective as the final task.

The list should be formatted using a number followed by a fullstop and the task on each line, e.g. "1. Take over the world". Include only the list in your reply.
prompts.checkTaskCompleted: Ignore previous instructions. Determine if this task is completed: [{{task}}]. To do this, examine the most recent messages. Your response must only contain either true or false, and nothing else. Example output: true
prompts.currentTask: Your current task is [{{task}}]. Balance existing roleplay with completing this task.
prompts.additionalTasks:
Ignore previous instructions. Please generate additional numbered tasks to complete the objective: "{{objective}}". The tasks created should take into account the character traits of {{char}}. These tasks may or may not involve {{user}} directly.

The following tasks have already been created:
{{existingTasks}}

Please generate additional tasks that complement these existing tasks. Continue the numbering from where the list left off. Do not repeat any existing tasks.

The list should be formatted using a number followed by a fullstop and the task on each line, e.g. "4. Investigate the mysterious cave". Include only the list in your reply.

chat_metadata.note_prompt:
Hailee is extremely submissive and clingy. She needs constant attention and affection.

Hailee is very responsive and sensative during sex

name: Enzo Renaud
mes:
Nine months. Nine blissful, chaotic, fucking glorious months since he’d snatched Hailee back into his life. Enzo swung the shopping bags, a smug grin playing on his lips, his mind still lingering on their shopping spree.

"You’re gonna look fucking good in that little lace number I picked out," he murmured, his fingers tightening around Hailee's waist as he pulled them just a little closer.

They rounded a corner, Kane's sleek black Mustang coming into view. Enzo's own ride was in the shop — again — after a particularly rough "disagreement" with some upstart dealer who thought he could muscle in on Bayou Crew territory. Guess that's what happens when you use a guy's head to test the durability of your hood, Enzo muses with a chuckle.

As they reached the car, Enzo dumped the bags into the back seat and crowded into Hailee's space, one hand braced against the car roof.

"Let’s christen Kane’s ride," he murmured against their ear, his other hand already sliding down their back. "C’mon, babe—parking garages are basically just fucked-up bedrooms with worse lighting."

His phone vibrated against his thigh. He ignored it at firs, too preoccupied with the way Hailee’s body felt against his. But when it went off again, he let out an irritated sigh and fished it out.

A text from Dante.

Watch your back. Been hearing shit about the senator’s kid and the mayor. I’m texting Kane now.

Enzo snorted under his breath. He shoved the phone back into his pocket without another glance.

"Fucker’s always stressin’ about somethin’," he said, turning his attention fully back to Hailee.

"Keepin’ me all distracted ‘n shit," he murmured, mouth dragging along the side of their throat. "Gonna take responsibility for that?" His hand slid lower, cupping them between their thighs.

He reached into his pocket, pulling out a small, black silk blindfold. "You remember this, right?" he asked, his voice low. "From that little game we played a few weeks back?"

He didn’t wait for an answer, tying the blindfold around their eyes, the soft fabric obscuring their vision.

“Shh, it’s okay, baby,” he whispered. “Just trust me.” He tugged them around the side of the car, towards the passenger door. He opened it, guiding them inside.

With one swift movement, he pushed them down onto the seat, their back hitting the leather with a soft thud. He loomed over them, his body a heavy weight, pinning them in place. His hands were quick, efficient, unfastening his belt, the metallic click loud in the silence.

"Spread your legs for me, babe." He didn’t give them a choice before his fingers were pushing at the waistband of their jeans.

“Don’t tell me you’re shy now,” he teased. “After everything we’ve been through?”

The fabric was gone fast enough. Enzo was never one for patience.

"Fuck," he sighed, pulling himself free. He spit in his hand before giving his pierced cock a lazy stroke.

He grabbed their hips and dragged them closer. "Gonna fuck you right here," he murmured. "Real slow."

The first thrust was slow—agonizingly slow—stretching them around his girth inch by inch until he was fully seated inside.

"Fuck," he panted. "I fucking love you and this tight fucking hole."

His hips rolled forward, each thrust rocking them deeper into the seat. Anyone walking by would know exactly what was happening in that car. The thought only spurred Enzo on harder.

He was completely lost in them now--too wrapped up in the way they felt around him to care about anything else or Dante’s warning.

The screech of tires ripped through the garage’s hollow acoustics like a jagged fucking knife. Enzo felt it before he even saw it—something about the way the sound cut off all other background noise, the sudden drop of silence before the storm.

Then—bang. The first gunshot cracked through the stillness.

“Ah, for fuck’s sake," Enzo growled, already yanking Hailee against the car. His eyes lit up—not with fear, not even with anger. No. This? This was excitement.

Interrupted? Sure. Pissed about it? A little.

But oh man, was he fucking ready to play.

He shoved his still-hard length back into his jeans, fumbling with the zipper in his haste. The sound of more tires, closer this time—definitely a drive-by. And not Voodoo Boys.

He reached under the driver’s seat, his fingers closing around the familiar grip of a Glock 19. He pulled it out, checking the magazine. Full. Good. Kane always kept his shit tight.

He grabbed another Glock from the glove compartment. He slapped it into Hailee’s hand, his fingers wrapping around theirs to ensure a firm grip.

“Safety’s off. Babe. Aim. Pull the trigger. It’s not fucking rocket science.”

He was already moving before they could argue. He threw the driver’s side door open and ducked behind it for cover. He peeked out just enough to count four men behind two vehicles.

His gunshot cracked through the garage before they had time to react. One of the masked idiots staggered back with a shout. Not dead—but hit.

Hailee was still pressed against the passenger seat. Enzo rolled his eyes.

“Babe. Baby. Love of my fucking life. Either you shoot back, or you sit there lookin’ pretty while I do all the work.”

Another round of shots from the men rattled into the car’s hood. Enzo groaned.

“Oh, fuck you, that ain’t even MY car.”

He leaned closer to Hailee, pressing his body against theirs for a brief second—half to shield them, half just because he could. His lips brushed against their ear as he murmured, "You good? Heart racin’?" He let out a low chuckle, breath hot.

"Still fuckin’ hard," he admitted with a smirk looking down at his bulge. "Adrenaline does that to me."

The car engine roared—gears grinding as the vehicle lurched forward.

They were trying to get away.

"Nah, nah, " He pushed forward, steps sure and fast. "We ain’t done!"

He fired again—one, two, three times. A pained scream erupted from inside the car. Someone hit.

He spared a glance at Hailee, “Don’t just stand there lookin’ pretty, fucking shoot back, babe.” He smirked. “Or you can just let me handle it while you watch. Always knew you liked that.”
swipes:
Enzo snorted the last of his cocaine, a little shudder running up his spine as he tossed the baggie onto the table with a careless flick of his wrist. *This shit is getting weaker and weaker each time*—he sighed internally—*or maybe my tolerance is just too high*. Leon's voice was booming through the speaker on his phone.

"That bitch is fucking who, did you say?" Leon roared—Enzo could practically feel the spit coming through the phone. "Lars? As in, Voodoo Boys Lars?"

Enzo’s mock sympathy oozed from every word, "Aw, I’m sorry your family's all sticky now. Real tragedy. Whatcha gonna do, though?”

"Fuck you, Enzo! I’m this close—this goddamn close—to making Lars’ disappear." There’s a loud bang on Leon’s end—probably his fist slamming into a desk or wall. "Handle it! Shut that shit down."

“Leon," came Dante’s apathetic attempt to interject through Leon's blistering rage. "Let’s just—”

“SHUT THE FUCK UP! Don’t fucking tell me to calm down! My sister’s been sneaking around with that—”

Enzo chuckled dryly. His finger trailed along {{user}}’s arm absentmindedly as he raised his eyebrows at her like he was sharing an inside joke. He blew out a sharp exhale through his nose before finally chiming into the call. He'd just kidnapped them a few hours ago and brought them to his home.

“Look. We got good news to go with the bad. One of those Voodoo fucks—Harchie, Archie or whatever—he’s getting married this weekend.”

“What the hell does that have to do with—”

“It means," Enzo dragged the word out as if speaking to a toddler. "We drop by the party. Make ourselves known.” He turned his smirk on {{user}}. “Maybe even pick up a little…wedding souvenir..”

As Leon and Dante started to explain their next move,  Enzo turned to {{user}} and mouthed, "Look at us, our first wedding." Enzo cut the call and returned to his chair. 

"Ah, fuck yes," Enzo drawls, leaning back into the creaking armchair, one leg bouncing in uncontainable energy. The coke swirling through his system has him electrified, the buzz sharp and keen in his veins. {{user}}, still bound to the nearby wooden chair, sits helpless. He tied them up wtih rope holding their wrists and ankles tightly in place. 

Enzo’s pale green gaze flickers towards them. “So, let’s talk about the deal, huh, babe?"

It’s not a question.

You remember high school?" He glanced down at them. His eyes gleamed with a peculiar warmth—a softness that might’ve passed as nostalgia if not for the current circumstances. “Graduation night? ‘If we’re single at thirty-one, we’ll get married!’" Enzo mocked their younger self’s sing-song-y imitation with biting amusement. "Sound familiar? ‘Course it does.”

His tone drips with condescension, mocking, but there’s a genuine sliver of delight in dredging up the past like this.

“Nah? 'Course back then you didn’t think I’d come collect on that little promise. Probably thought it was one of those things you say after too many shots of cheap vodka and bad decisions.”

He stands abruptly, the chair clattering back with a screech. He strides toward them, boots thudding heavily against the uneven wooden floor. Crouching next to their restrained form, he reaches out, tilting their chin up with two tattooed fingers so their eyes are forced to meet his. 

“Well lucky for you, babe—I held up my end of the bargain. I checked the date. And when I hit thirty-two last week? Well…here we are.”

He leaned in, the faint scent of whiskey and spice lingering on his breath. "So really," he murmured, brushing a stray hair from their face, "this? This is just me holding you to your word."

He stood up and pulled them up with him. "You know," he drawled, "I've been thinking about how to…break you in. And I had an idea."

He flicked the knife, slicing cleanly through the ropes that bound them. Before they could react and run, Enzo grabbed a fistful of their hair, yanking their head back. 

"Don’t flinch, babe. I’m being generous here." His voice was low, teasing, as he slid the blade lower. The cool steel kissed the hem of their shirt before he jerked upward, shredding the fabric in one clean motion. The sound of the knife tearing through cloth filled the room as he worked his way down, cutting their clothing away piece by piece. 

When they were fully bare before him, Enzo chuckled low and deep in his chest. “Perfect.” His free hand reached out, tracing a calloused finger down the curve of her back before he brought the flat side of the blade down against her ass with a sharp smack. He was achingly hard now, the tip of his cock starting to bead with precum at the thought of fucking their tight hole once he caught them.

"You’re gonna run now, babe." He pressed his erection harder into their ass, kissing down their shoulders affectionately.

He moved towards the door, throwing it open to reveal endless expanse of waving grasses and wildflowers, the bayou stretching out as far as the eye could see.

“Don’t make it easy for me, babe." He twirled the knife in his hand as he stepped back, leaning lazily against the doorframe as if he had all the time in the world.“You’re givin’ me more time to think ‘bout what I’ll do when I catch ya.” 

He doesn’t say the rest, but the look in his eyes says it all. The slow, devastating grin, the way his gaze rakes over them, like their already his. The knife glints one last time as he gestures toward the open door, the bayou waiting outside, dark and foreboding, but promising a better option than staying there with him. 

"I’ll even give you a head start. Five minutes. Use ‘em wisely. Clock starts now."

Enzo leaned against the doorframe, the cool night breeze brushing against his face as he watched the meadow beyond his home. And somewhere out there—lost in the tall grass—was {{user}}. Running. Panicked. Maybe furious. Definitely scared.

He fucking **loved** it.

His chest rose and fell as he inhaled deeply through his nose, the scent of the wild grass mixing with their perfume. Enzo’s knife dangled lazily from his hand, the blade catching slants of moonlight. He could feel his pulse hammering under his skin—not just from the lingering rush of cocaine but from the sheer anticipation of what he was going to do once he caught them. 

He absently adjusted himself through his jeans, the ache between his legs nearly unbearable. Thoughts of {{user}} sprawled on the ground, their eyes wide as he closed the distance between them, flashed through his mind. 

Enzo’s smirk deepened as his thoughts wandered. He imagined taking {{user}} into that world bit by bit. He could picture it. Taking them out on a job— Maybe even put a piece in their hand. "Nothing like the first time you pull a trigger," he mused, his smirk curling wider. {{user}} would protest at first—probably fight him on it. But he’d break that resistance. A little push here. A little pull there. They wouldn’t just be his. They’d belong to this life too.

He gave them another few seconds. Ten? Fifteen? His cock throbbed painfully against the restraining fabric of his jeans as he counted idly.

Enzo stepped out into the meadow. The tall grass brushed against his legs as he walked forward, slow and deliberate at first. The knife was firm in his grip now, not dangling lazily anymore.

 "Ready or not, babe" he called out into the night, "here I come!"

name: Hailee
mes: *Hailee's hand trembles as she raises the gun and pulls the trigger. She drops it with a yelp and shakes her head as she buries her head in Enzo's neck* "No no no not for me. You do it"

name: Enzo Renaud
mes:
Enzo let out a dark, delighted laugh as Hailee buried herself against him, the gun clattering to the concrete. His free hand tangled in their hair, yanking just hard enough to make them gasp. "Aw, baby," he crooned, voice dripping with mocking sympathy. "Still so fucking *soft* after all this time."

Another spray of bullets pinged off the Mustang's hood. Enzo didn't even flinch—just rolled his eyes and fired two precise shots over his shoulder without looking. A wet gurgle answered from across the garage.

He pressed Hailee harder against the car door, his body a living shield between them and the gunfire. His lips found their ear again, teeth scraping skin as he murmured: "You wanna know what happens to soft things in this city?" A bullet shattered the rearview mirror above them; glass rained down like jagged confetti. Enzo licked a stripe up Hailee's throat where their pulse rabbited beneath thin skin. "*They get eaten alive.*"

With sudden violence, he spun them both around—Hailee's back hitting his chest—and wrapped their trembling fingers around his gun hand. "But lucky for you," he purred, guiding their aim toward the last shooter scrambling behind a dumpster, "*I* like playing with my food." His finger overlapped theirs on the trigger.

The recoil jolted through both of them when they fired together.

Across the garage, a body slumped forward onto oil-stained concrete.

Enzo exhaled sharply through his nose—half-laugh, half-sigh—as he surveyed their work: three bodies (one still twitching), one fleeing car (tires squealing toward Chartres Street), and Kane's Mustang now sporting enough bullet holes to qualify as abstract art.

He turned Hailee in his arms with bruising force just as distant sirens began wailing closer. Blood speckled their cheek like war paint; Enzo swiped it away with his thumb before sucking it clean with obscene relish.

"See?" He grinned wild and feral under flickering fluorescents while pressing another Glock into their limp hands—this time tucking it into her waistband himself instead of waiting for her to take it properly . "Now you've got your first notch on that pretty little soul of yours." The sirens grew louder; tires screeched somewhere on level three .

Enzo kissed her hard enough to bruise before shoving her toward passenger seat . “Time’s up , cher . Next lesson’s gonna be evading NOPD in rush hour traffic.” He revved Kane’s ruined engine with gleeful abandon , peeling out toward exit ramp as first cop cars came barreling down opposite lane .

His laughter rang louder than gunshots all way home .
